Key Match Events: Anthony Edwards scored 29 points and shot 7-for-14 from 3-point range as the Minnesota Timberwolves escaped with a 119-116 win over the Denver Nuggets on Friday night in Minneapolis.
The Timberwolves trailed by 10 points in the fourth quarter before closing the game on a 17-4 run to secure the victory.
Edwards scored the go-ahead basket with a floating jump shot that put Minnesota on top 117-116 with 25.7 seconds to go.
Gobert added a pair of free throws with 10.1 seconds left to increase the lead to three.
Jokic fired a 3-point attempt from the right corner that missed in the waning seconds.
Denver stormed to a 25-3 run to grab a 112-102 lead with 4:17 remaining.
Braun leaped for a dunk over Gobert, the Timberwolves' 7-foot-1 center.
Both players received a technical foul after officials reviewed the play.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Jamal Murray was placed in concussion protocol after colliding with Randle in the third quarter.
Murray finished with six points, three assists and two rebounds in 22 minutes.
The Nuggets answered with an 18-2 run to even the score at 51-all with 4:09 left in the half.
The Timberwolves opened a 16-point lead in the second quarter.
Donte DiVincenzo dished a pass to Gobert for a basket to put Minnesota on top 49-33 with 7:18 remaining.
Others: Aaron Gordon scored a game-high 31 points and grabbed 11 rebounds for Denver.
Nikola Jokic had 26 points, 13 assists and nine rebounds, and Michael Porter Jr. also logged 26 points.
Christian Braun added 14 points for Denver.
